title: Feira de Santana: Governo Colbert Martins promove Ãºltima ediÃ§Ã£o de OrientaÃ§Ã£o Profissional com foco em gestÃ£o do tempo
text:
A Prefeitura Municipal de Feira de Santana, por meio da Secretaria Municipal de Juventude, realizarÃ¡ no dia 11 de dezembro de 2024 a terceira e Ãºltima ediÃ§Ã£o do programa de OrientaÃ§Ã£o Profissional. O evento serÃ¡ realizado das 8 Ã s 12 horas, no auditÃ³rio da UNIFACS, e marca o encerramento de um ciclo de atividades voltadas para o desenvolvimento profissional de jovens da cidade. O programa Ã© realizado em parceria com o Instituto Brasileiro PrÃ³-EducaÃ§Ã£o, Trabalho e Desenvolvimento (ISBET) e tem como objetivo proporcionar aos jovens ferramentas para o crescimento pessoal e profissional.
A ediÃ§Ã£o de dezembro abordarÃ¡ o tema â€œGestÃ£o do Tempoâ€, uma habilidade essencial tanto na vida pessoal quanto profissional. A proposta Ã© fornecer aos participantes conhecimentos prÃ¡ticos para organizar suas rotinas, estabelecer prioridades e equilibrar as diversas responsabilidades que podem surgir no cotidiano. A programaÃ§Ã£o do evento incluirÃ¡ dinÃ¢micas interativas, atividades em grupo e discussÃµes que possibilitarÃ£o a aplicaÃ§Ã£o imediata dos conceitos aprendidos.
AlÃ©m da capacitaÃ§Ã£o, os participantes terÃ£o a oportunidade de se cadastrar no banco de dados do ISBET, ampliando as chances de inserÃ§Ã£o no mercado de trabalho por meio de encaminhamentos para vagas em empresas parceiras. Durante o evento, os jovens conhecerÃ£o os benefÃ­cios desse programa, que oferece capacitaÃ§Ã£o teÃ³rica e prÃ¡tica, alÃ©m de orientaÃ§Ãµes sobre como se preparar para ingressar no mercado de trabalho, especialmente em empresas que investem no desenvolvimento de novos talentos.

Os certificados emitidos no final de cada ediÃ§Ã£o se destacam como um diferencial importante no currÃ­culo dos participantes, refletindo o investimento na qualificaÃ§Ã£o dos jovens de Feira de Santana.
A secretÃ¡ria de Juventude, SuÃ©llen Moreira, destacou o impacto do programa ao longo do ano e reafirmou o compromisso da gestÃ£o municipal com as polÃ­ticas pÃºblicas voltadas para a juventude.

author: @infobae
title: Venezuela respalda la "firme respuesta" de Claudia Sheinbaum a los aranceles de EE.UU. - Infobae
text:
Caracas, 16 abr (EFE).- Venezuela respaldÃ³ este miÃ©rcoles la "firme respuesta" de la presidenta de MÃ©xico, Claudia Sheinbaum, a la polÃ­tica arancelaria del mandatario de Estados Unidos, Donald Trump, cuyo Gobierno impuso tasas del 25 % al acero, aluminio y a la industria automotriz de ese paÃ­s latinoamericano, asÃ­ como a los productos fuera del tratado de libre comercio T-MEC.
A travÃ©s de Telegram, el titular de Exteriores venezolano, YvÃ¡n Gil, informÃ³ de una reuniÃ³n con el embajador mexicano en Caracas, Leopoldo de Gyves, a quien expresÃ³ su reconocimiento a Sheinbaum y a su "destacada gestiÃ³n y firme respuesta ante la imposiciÃ³n de aranceles".
SegÃºn el mensaje del canciller, ambos funcionarios revisaron durante el encuentro la agenda bilateral y reafirmaron "el compromiso mutuo de no interferir en los asuntos internos", asÃ­ como su disposiciÃ³n a "trabajar conjuntamente" para profundizar la integraciÃ³n regional.
La semana pasada, en la IX ReuniÃ³n de la Comunidad de Estados Latinoamericanos y CaribeÃ±os (Celac), Sheinbaum propuso convocar una 'Cumbre por el Bienestar EconÃ³mico' de la regiÃ³n, como respuesta a la guerra comercial y en pro de una mayor integraciÃ³n en esta materia.
En el evento, la mandataria considerÃ³ que la regiÃ³n tiene todo para fortalecerse por sÃ­ misma, incluida una poblaciÃ³n joven de 663 millones de habitantes, un PIB de 6,6 billones de dÃ³lares y abundantes recursos naturales.
Cuando el pasado 2 de abril Trump anunciÃ³ lo que llamÃ³ "aranceles recÃ­procos" que implicaron tasas generalizadas del 10 % y unos volÃºmenes superiores para otras regiones y paÃ­ses -como China o la UniÃ³n Europea (UE)- que exportan mucho a EE.UU., MÃ©xico y CanadÃ¡ quedaron fuera de la lista de paÃ­ses castigados.
Este lunes, Sheinbaum asegurÃ³ que su Gobierno busca negociar una reducciÃ³n en materia de aranceles con EE.UU. en los sectores automotriz, de acero y aluminio. EFE

author: Maisy Rae
title: Matildas Katrina Gorry and her fiancÃ©e Clara are expecting
text:
It's been five months since Katrina Gorry and her
Matildasteammates wowed the nation with their incredible success at the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup.
But 2024 is going to be even bigger for Katrina, who recently left Swedish football club Vittsjo GIK and has yet to announce where she'll go next.
With the Paris Olympics now firmly in the national team's sights and wedding planning on the cards, there's also the "small" addition of a new bub for Katrina and her fiancee
Clara Markstedtto welcome.
The couple recently shared they were expecting their
second childâ€“ a boy â€“ much to the joy of Katrina's teammates, who have already put their hands up for babysitting duties.
"[They] were all pretty excited and they wanted a boy, so they're happy!" Katrina, 31, laughs.
With Clara due to give birth in early June, it's going to be a hectic few weeks for the family as the Matildas head off to training camp for the Olympics in July.
Katrina's mum Linda and stepdad David will also be on hand to help look after the couple's two-year-old daughter
Harper.
"I think it couldn't be timed any better," says Clara, 34. "The playing season will be over and it'll be lovely to have a few weeks together â€“ if I don't go over [my due date] too much!"
Katrina welcomed Harper via IVF in 2021 and the couple used the same sperm donor this time.
In September they discovered Clara was pregnant just a day after her father Peter was farewelled in an emotional service after he passed away unexpectedly during the World Cup.
"We never thought [IVF] would work first go for us," says Katrina. "And the fact that we're having a boy and it happened around [Clara's] dad's funeral... it's like we lost someone so special, but now we've gained someone special too."Clara smiles.
"I was frustrated because he didn't have his time. So, we were sitting at the funeral, and I was just thinking, 'If you want to do something for me, just make this stick,'" Clara says, looking down at her bump.
"I'd like to think there's a meaning with everything."
Katrina's adorable daughter Harper, who captured the hearts of fans with her on-field antics during the World Cup, is said to be practising a lot for the arrival of her sibling.
"We talk about her little brother, and she's noticed the change in my body," says Clara.
"She's got about 20 dollies, all of their names are Oliver, and she drives them around in a little pram while she shushes them."
"We've asked her what she's going to do when the baby starts crying, and apparently she's going to give him a babycino!"
Now having reached the halfway point in her pregnancy, Clara says she's back to feeling more like herself after experiencing a rough few months.
"I just tried a new medication and it's made a huge difference," she says.
"When I've been sat in the bathroom being sick, Harper has been in there with me, saying, 'Get up Ra Ra, let's go out.'"
Katrina adds, laughing, "I'm feeling great, I've had no nausea or anything this time around."
"I feel bad as I definitely wasn't as unwell as Clara has been. She's amazing and has been dealing with it so well."
"It's a bit strange to not be able to feel everything and that I'm watching him grow, instead of carrying him but it has been nice to have a partner to go through it with this time."
The couple, who met in late 2021 while Clara was also playing at Vittsjo GIK, have spent the last month holidaying in Australia and celebrating Christmas with Katrina's family in Brisbane.
They say there have also been plenty of encounters with fans, who have stopped Katrina to talk about the impact of the World Cup.
"It's been pretty incredible to see little boys coming up and telling me that their favourite player is a female athlete," says the Matildas veteran.
"As an athlete, you always want to leave the game in a better place, and I really feel like we've done that."
"I hope that everyone who followed our journey really felt how much love we gave them and, in return, how much love we felt from them."

author: Ã–mer
title: Epic Games gives another action RPG game today
text: Epic Games Store continues to make certain games free every day as part of its holiday sales. In this context, Epic Games, which has made many productions from indie productions to big budget games available, announced the December 28 free game. Epic Games Store free games (December 28) Cat Quest, an action RPG, is currently available for free on the Epic Games Store. Dubbed â€œDiablo the Catâ€ and released in 2017, Cat Quest is about players controlling a cat. Developed by Gentlebros, it will be free until December 29, 19.00. Featuring real-time combat, dungeon adventures and equipment upgrades, Cat Quest is set in the colorful world of Felingard. From a captured town to helping wizards, there are many details for cats to discover. On the other hand, the game has many different locations such as Bermewdaâ€™s Triangle, Furbidden Fields and Pawt City, allowing you to enjoy the RPG pleasure. Epic Games made Cursed to Golf free the other day, which golf lovers should definitely check out. Offering a fun experience with rogue-like elements, the production was offered for free until this evening. Cat Quest, whose normal price is $2,99 can be downloaded for free until December 29. After that date, another game will be offered as part of Christmas gifts. You must follow these steps to get the game for free; - Step: Sign in via the Epic Games Store website or desktop app. - Step: Enter the â€œCat Questâ€ page. - Step: Click the purchase button on the right side. - Step: Wait for the process to complete. So what do you think about this issue? How did you find the game that Epic Games Store made free? Donâ€™t forget to share your opinions with us in the Comments section below.
